question: In which Asian Games, Kabaddi was first introduced for promotion purposes as a demonstration sport?
explanation: In 1951 Asian Games, Kabaddi was first introduced for promotion purposes as a demonstration sport. India has been credited with having helped to popularise kabaddi as a competitive sport, with the first organized competitions occurring in the 1920s, their introduction to the programme of the National Games of India in 1938, the establishment of the All-India Kabaddi Federation in 1950, and it is played as a demonstration sport at the inaugural 1951 Asian Games in New Delhi. These developments helped to formalize the sport, which had traditionally been played in villages, for legitimate international competition.
